sen.j: 藤原 盛憲（ふじわら の もりのり、生没年未詳）は、平安時代末期の廷臣。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Morinori (date of birth and death unknown) was a retainer of Imperial court at the end of the Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Morinori (year of birth and death unknown) was a retainer of the Imperial court during the late Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Morinori (year of birth and death unknown) was a retainer of the Imperial court during the late Heian period.
Also known as Morinori KAJUJI.
He was also known as Morinori KAJUJI.

sen.j: 勧修寺流藤原氏の流れを汲む少納言藤原顕憲の長男。
sen.e: He was the first son of Shonagon (Minor Counselor) FUJIWARA no Akinori, descended from Kajuji line of the Fujiwara clan.
He was the first son of Shonagon (lesser councilor of state) FUJIWARA no Akinori, who descended from Kajuji line of the Fujiwara clan.
He was the first son of Shonagon (lesser councilor of state) FUJIWARA no Akinori, who descended from Kajuji line of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 弟に藤原憲親、藤原経憲、玄顕、能円らが、子に藤原清房がある。
sen.e: His brothers included FUJIWARA no Norichika, FUJIWARA no Tsunenori, Genken and Noen, and his child was FUJIWARA no Kiyofusa.
sen.cmt: 「玄顕」の読み方を確認できませんでした。
sen.e: His brothers included FUJIWARA no Norichika, FUJIWARA no Tsunenori, Genken, and Noen, and his child was FUJIWARA no Kiyofusa.
His younger brothers included FUJIWARA no Norichika, FUJIWARA no Tsunenori, Genken (玄顕), and Noen, and his child was FUJIWARA no Kiyofusa.
sen.cmt: 読み不明の漢字を補足しました。

sen.j: 正四位下、少納言、式部大輔。
sen.e: Ranked at Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), he was a Shonagon and Shikibu no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial).
With the rank of Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Morinori was a Shonagon and a Shikibu no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial).
With the rank of Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), he was a Shonagon and Shikibu no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial).

sen.j: 父の姉妹が藤原忠実の室となり藤原頼長の生母となったことから、従兄弟として頼長に近侍した。
sen.e: Because his father's sister became FUJIWARA no Tadazane's wife and FUJIWARA no Yorinaga's real mother, he served Yorinaga as a cousin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Because his father's sister became FUJIWARA no Tadazane's wife and FUJIWARA no Yorinaga's real mother, he served Yorinaga as a cousin.
Because his father's sisters became FUJIWARA no Tadazane's wife and FUJIWARA no Yorinaga's biological mother, he served Yorinaga as a cousin.

sen.j: その外出の際にはたびたび前駆を務めた。
sen.e: And when Yorinaga went out, he often took the lead.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: And when Yorinaga left the palace grounds, Morinori often took the lead of the procession.
When Yorinaga left the palace grounds, Morinori often took the lead of the procession.

sen.j: さらに崇徳上皇の殿上人でもあったことから、保元元年（1156年）の保元の乱に当たっては、兄弟達とともに上皇・頼長方に参加した。
sen.e: Besides, since he was also the retired Emperor Sutoku's tenjobito (a high-ranking courtier allowed into the Imperial Palace), when Hogen Disturbance broke out, he joined the retired emperor and Yorinaga.

Since he was also Retired Emperor Sutoku's tenjobito (a high-ranking courtier allowed into the Imperial Palace), he joined sides with the retired emperor and Yorinaga when the Hogen Disturbance broke out.
Since he was also Retired Emperor Sutoku's tenjobito (a high-ranking courtier allowed into the Imperial Palace), he joined sides with the retired emperor and Yorinaga when the Hogen War broke out.
sen.cmt: 指示書に合わせました。

sen.j: 敗北後は頼長に随って逃亡、頼長の横死後出家するが赦されず捕虜となる。
sen.e: After being defeated, he escaped with Yorinaga, and after the unnatural death of Yorinaga, he went into priesthood but he was not pardoned and was taken prisoner.
After being defeated, he escaped with Yorinaga, but after the unnatural death of Yorinaga, Morinori decided to go into priesthood, an act which did not pardon him and was eventually taken prisoner.
After being defeated, he escaped with Yorinaga, but was captured not permitting to go into priesthood after the unnatural death of Yorinaga.

sen.j: さらに、近衛天皇や美福門院らを呪詛したとの嫌疑によって、経憲とともに拷問を加えられた後、佐渡国へと流罪となった。
sen.e: Furthermore, he was tortured together with Tsunenori on suspicion that they had cursed Emperor Konoe, Bifukumonin and others, and then they were exiled to Sado Province.

sen.j: 孫の上杉重房は丹波国何鹿郡上杉庄（京都府綾部市上杉町一帯）に所領を授かって上杉を名乗り、その子孫は後世上杉氏として繁栄している。
sen.e: His grandson Shigefusa UESUGI received a shoryo (territory) in Uesugi no sho, Ikaruga County, Tamba Province and adopted the name Uesugi, and his descendants have prospered as the Uesugi clan.

His grandson Shigefusa UESUGI received a shoryo (territory) in Uesugi no sho, Ikaruga County, Tamba Province (a region around Uesugi-cho, Ayabe-shi, Kyoto Prefecture) and adopted the name Uesugi, and his descendants have prospered as the Uesugi clan.
